article.headline: Gizmodo: The 25 Most Popular Passwords Of 2014
article.body:
So a story from Gizmodo appeared on my feedly page today; listing the 25 most-used passwords of 2014. I thought the list was hilarious. I mean, I'm sure only fairly simple passwords are likely to make a list such as this - any decent password is unique and therefore wouldnt be popular. Still a good chuckle.

The top ten most-popular passwords of 2014 (according to Gizmodo - sourced from SplashData):

  1. 123456 (Unchanged)
  2. password (Unchanged)
  3. 12345 (Up 17)
  4. 12345678 (Down 1)
  5. qwerty (Down 1)
  6. 123456789 (Unchanged)
  7. 1234 (Up 9)
  8. baseball (New)
  9. dragon (New)
  10. football (New)

As you can see, some good classic passwords are there - 'dragon' is surprising though.

The full article is available from Gizmodo here.
